channel.title: Comments on: List Of Dummy Image Generators

item.title: By: New additions to Ad Packs & Yoggrt | Online Advertising Blog – BuySellAds.com
item.dc:creator: New additions to Ad Packs & Yoggrt | Online Advertising Blog – BuySellAds.com
item.description: […] a fan of hipsters means you have to support the original. Dummy Image was the first site of it’s kind and we dig that. We are happy to have Dummy Image as part of our Web Developer Ad […]
item.content:encoded: […] a fan of hipsters means you have to support the original. Dummy Image was the first site of it’s kind and we dig that. We are happy to have Dummy Image as part of our Web Developer Ad […]

item.title: By: Dave
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description: I use http://lil.im - the lil' image placeholder service - it's easy to remember :)
item.content:encoded: I use http://lil.im – the lil’ image placeholder service – it’s easy to remember

item.title: By: Jeremy
item.dc:creator: Jeremy
item.description: DummyImage.com seems to be down. I've used it for ages. :(
item.content:encoded: DummyImage.com seems to be down. I’ve used it for ages.

item.title: By: reverse phone lookup
item.dc:creator: reverse phone lookup
item.description: An image placeholder is a dummy image designed to draw attention to the need for an actual image. Changes to the software since then have also made the system less effective, and for both of these reasons it is not currently maintained. Many such images still remain active on articles, and this page is preserved as an explanation of them. Thanks.
item.content:encoded: An image placeholder is a dummy image designed to draw attention to the need for an actual image. Changes to the software since then have also made the system less effective, and for both of these reasons it is not currently maintained. Many such images still remain active on articles, and this page is preserved as an explanation of them. Thanks.

item.title: By: JRBeaman
item.dc:creator: JRBeaman
item.description: Interesting that you never explain how it works, or what it is.
item.content:encoded: Interesting that you never explain how it works, or what it is.
